message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.RO 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with stochastic multi-armed bandits, which is a classic problem in reinforcement learning. It could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves decision-making under uncertainty. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as it introduces new algorithms for solving the problem. It could also be classified under cs.GT (Game Theory) as it involves competing against the arm with the best risk-return trade-off. Finally, it could be categorized under cs.RO (Robotics) as multi-armed bandits are often used in robotics for decision-making.
